raw_comment:
students with relatives who went to the same college are more likely to be admitted than students with no relatives who went to that college.

why do colleges favor students with relatives who went to the same college, and why are the 70th and 90th percentile less likely to be admitted than the rest?

most people here are planning to go to college and this affects them and their hunt for a college that suits them.
  
are colleges being a little too greedy?
ace_sentences: Some students have relatives who went to a college.
Some students have no relatives who went to that college.
A student with such a relative is more likely to be admitted to that college than a student without such a relative.
The author asks why colleges favor a student who has a relative who went to the same college.
Some applicants are in the 70th percentile.
Some applicants are in the 90th percentile.
An applicant in the 70th percentile is less likely to be admitted than other applicants.
An applicant in the 90th percentile is less likely to be admitted than other applicants.
Most people here plan to go to college.
This situation affects their search for a college that suits them.
The author asks whether colleges are too greedy.
